alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 20 at 1:19PM PST until January 23 at 1:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM PST TUESDAY MONO COUNTY ABOVE 7000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Snow. Total snow accumulations through Monday night 6 to 12 inches above 7000 feet near and west of US-395, with 10 to 20 inches near the Sierra crest. Below 7000 feet, 1 to 3 inches with locally higher amounts up to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph, with gusts to 70 mph along the Sierra crest. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...Until 1 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult at times. The hazardous conditions could impact the daily commutes through Monday night, with the most widespread impacts expected Monday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The main periods of snow are expected late tonight, and again late Sunday night through Monday morning. At other times, lighter snow will continue mainly near the Sierra crest. Road conditions will vary from wet to slushy and snow covered across Mono County this evening through Monday night, check with Caltrans for the latest road conditions.
info.instruction: Even lighter snowfall causes major travel delays, especially during periods of high traffic volume. Be sure to allow extra time to reach your destination. Leave extra space between vehicles since it takes longer to stop on slick roadways.
